Shipping

UK Delivery is £4.95 using Royal Mail ‘Signed For’ Service. This service aims to deliver the next working day, but can take 2-3 days. FREE Next Day Delivery Shipping on all orders over £150. For all emergencies, or if you do not want to wait, we offer UK Guaranteed Next Day Delivery Service through Royal Mail which is £7.95 (Orders must be placed before 1pm).

International Shipping using Airsure Service costs £12.50

Returns

Please let us know if you are in any way unhappy with your purchase(s). We would be happy to exchange or refund within 7 days of delivery, providing the item is returned to us in the exact condition it was received: therefore undamaged, unworn and in its original packaging.

settings.heading: Care Instructions
settings.content:
• Skin and hair products (lotions and perfumes), along with other chemicals, can tarnish silver and corrode gold/stones. You are therefore advised to always remove all jewellery before using these products.
  • Try not to get gold vermeil jewellery wet as the coating come off more easily with water. Likewise hot weather, sunlight and the sea can be damaging. Chlorine can permanently discolour gold, silver and plated jewellery so you should avoid wearing it in pools and hot tubs.
  • It is also advisable to remove jewellery when exercising, cleaning, gardening or any other rough or physical work. Try not to wear it overnight to avoid tangling and scratching.
  • All jewellery should be stored separately to avoid scratching and rubbing against one another. A silk lined pouch like the one we supply is perfect for this. Stones, particularly emeralds, are very easily scratched. It is even possible to scratch a diamond with another diamond so take care when wearing and storing your diamond jewellery.
  • Do not store jewellery next to heating vents, windowsills or in the bathroom, as damp and hot conditions will cause the jewellery to tarnish.
  • To clean your jewellery rub the piece gently with a soft lint-free cloth or wash in warm soaping water in the case of solid gold. It is also recommended that you visit a jeweller once a year to have it cleaned professionally. This will keep them looking their best!
